post.body: Postal carrier won't go in a yard where the dog's not restrained, or if an animal will otherwise threaten them.
In L.A., they won't deliver mail if your sprinklers will get them wet on their route.
Relatives none the wiser re: my slobbishness. They didn't peek into the "guest bedroom", i.e., walk-in closet. *lol*
*LOL* He always snookers me into being his messenger boy. *lmao*
Ah okay, thanks. I wasn't sure. Makes sense, though.
JOB said, " It was a cheese danish, microwaved for 17 seconds. It was quite tasty and now it is gone. Time's up!"
JOB said, "He shouldn't be wasting his time on Twitter when he should be wasting his time at PanE!"
I think there is one, but I can't remember what it is.
Is CTF on a break? JOB is complaining that the tree hasn't been updated. *LOL*
That's what shoveling sunshine's all about. Lie on the ground (sunscreen and shades are important) and move your arms around.
Goofing the Heck Off - that's me.
Not allowed to access outside webmail either. We are locked down. *lol*
I figure it's only a matter of time before they nail me for emailing posts to myself. *lol* But writing's an obsession.
Can't bring eFiles to work anymore, flash drives etc are banned. I print out hardcopies to work from, email posts back.
Can't access the sites at work, but I do most of my writing at work.
It IS a typo! Supposed to be Ile de la Tortue. I was told they knew but let the typo stay.
Yeah, ain't it something? T-shirt weather all day but soon as the sun goes down, it's cold!
Saw that movie recently, borrowed it from JOB. Excellent film, and I agree, Penelope Cruz is amazing in it.
And even if they are literate, being cats, do you think they obey posted signs? *ppfft*
I realized the note was directed at cats, but until then, I didn't know the cats in our complex were literate.
We have potted ficus trees in the common area outside our units. A neighbor once posted a note on one: "Please don't crap here"
Enough winding down. Have to get Xmas cards finished and mailed.
I'm bummed Weekend America's last program will be in January.
Relatives visited, left; now winding down listening to Weekend America on the radio.
Time to log off and tidy the place up. Relatives are dropping by in a few hours, don't want to confirm their suspicions that I'm a slob.
JOB should get his own Twitter account. *LOL*
I could go outside and shovel sunshine *lol*
I feel less restricted at PE. Novels have ratings at PH, so I always feel I have to be mindful. No such thing occurs to me at PE.
You'd think I'd have to edit something coming from PE to PH; but most of what I write at PE could be posted at PH.
I'm cross-posting a story from Conquest at PanErotica to Ile de Torture at PanHistoria. Shouldn't have to edit much for content. Funny that.
So I'll probably write several posts during the coming week. *lol* I really need to discipline myself more at home. Maybe a similar office.
Two week vacation is over, it's back to the grind tomorrow. I'm so bummed. Except that I tend to write more at work than I do when I'm home.
Saw a trailer for the new Doctor Who soon to debut on BBC America here. I think the new actor will fit the bill just fine.
Tempted to eat leftover Buffalo hot wings for lunch. Made 'em last night & they came out really good.
It's Pin-up Month @ www.panerotica.us. Started a theme thread on the Dailies & it's getting good response.
Sad sight this time of year: denuded Xmas trees lying at the curb. I know they'll be mulched and composted, but it's still a sad sight.
Eating the last of the Christmas panettone. Holidays are over. Back to work on Monday. Hmm, better not get depressed until tomorrow.
I got a Twitter Grade of 71/100 from @grader. See: http://twitter.grader.com/VincenzoM Won't last long, I'm sure, so I had to tweet it.
Yesterday the roads were eerily empty. Today it's insanity again. I miss yesterday.
Wasn't a neighbor. Was a driving instructor in the neighborhood. What makes people think they can just litter like that?
